title: 3 bedroom cottage for rent
description: We are delighted to offer for rent `Flagship Cottage` this charming three-bedroom cottage to rent in a lovely, tranquil backwater location in the village of Dorchester-On-Thames, Oxfordshire. The property boasts character features that blend in perfectly with the beautiful surroundings of the village. This property presents an excellent opportunity for a family or couple looking for a beautiful and peaceful environment to call home. <PARA> The property comprises of a spacious living room that opens up to the private garden. The living room is perfect for relaxation with family and friends with its spacious layout and elegant furnishings. The large windows in the living room allow for plenty of natural light and views of the village allotments. The property also features a fitted kitchen with all the essential appliances. The cottage comes with three bedrooms, The main bedroom is spacious with an en-suite.The property features a family bathroom (and separate en suite to main bedroom). The bathroom comes with all the essential amenities, including a bathtub, shower, sink and toilet. It is the perfect place to unwind after a long day at work or exploring the village. One of the highlights of this property is the private garden and the aspect overlooking the village allotments. The garden is perfect for hosting summer barbeques or simply relaxing in the sun. It is a great place to soak in the beauty of the surrounding environment and indulge in the peace and tranquillity of the area. Good sized garden at the rear with a large secluded patio area. Parking on road at the front of the cottage and at the side. <PARA> Dorchester-On-Thames is a quintessential English village located in the heart of Oxfordshire. With its beautiful thatched cottages, historic buildings and peaceful surroundings, it is a perfect location for those looking to escape from the hustle and bustle of city life. The village is steeped in history and boasts some of the oldest buildings in England, including the beautiful Dorchester Abbey. <PARA> There are plenty of things to do in and around Dorchester-On-Thames. The village itself is perfect for leisurely walks and bike rides, with its quiet streets and picturesque views. For those who love history, Dorchester Abbey is a must-see, with its beautiful architecture and exquisite stained-glass windows. The village also has a number of pubs and restaurants that serve excellent food and refreshments, giving you the perfect opportunity to unwind and relax. For the more adventurous types, there is the nearby Wittenham Clumps where you can enjoy spectacular views of the surrounding countryside and marvel at the ancient hillforts. If you are looking for something a little more challenging, the River Thames provides the perfect opportunity for a number of water activities, including kayaking and rowing. <PARA> In conclusion, this charming three-bedroom cottage is the perfect place to call home in the tranquil and peaceful village of Dorchester-On-Thames. With plenty of things to do and see in and around the village, this location offers a perfect blend of history, culture and natural beauty, creating the perfect lifestyle for those looking to escape the stresses of city life. <PARA> Outgoings <PARA> Council tax band E <PARA> what3words /// <PARA> emailed.parts.thickens <PARA> Notice <PARA> All photographs are provided for guidance only. <PARA> Redress scheme provided by: The Property Ombudsman (D12072) <PARA> Client Money Protection provided by: NFOPP (A.R.L.A) (NFOPP (A.R.L.A)) <PARA>

title: 1 bedroom flat for rent
description: Welcome to a bright, characterful one-bedroom flat tucked inside a handsome Grade II Listed building in the heart of Clerkenwell—because modern living is better with a bit of history (and much better coffee). <PARA> Accessed via a staircase from Bourne Estate, this charming home spans approximately 354 sq ft and punches well above its weight. Double-glazed windows flood the flat with natural light while keeping the hustle and bustle firmly outside, delivering a calm, comfortable living space. <PARA> Location-wise, this is Clerkenwell at its finest—recently crowned The Sunday Times Best Places to Live 2024 (and for very good reason). It's a short walk away from Exmouth Market, serving up top-tier dining with favourites such as Moro and the original Caravan. Wander towards Exmouth Market for classics like The Quality Chop House and The Eagle, London’s first ever gastropub. <PARA> For weekday energy, Leather Lane Market is your go-to, alive Monday to Friday with street food, exceptional lunches and outstanding coffee from Prufrock and Attendant Coffee Roasters. Meanwhile, Conduit Street—less than 10 minutes away—offers a more relaxed pace, with beloved spots such as Ciao Bella and the acclaimed wine bar Noble Rot. <PARA> Green spaces are never far away, with Spa Fields, Lincoln Fields and Coram’s Field Pitches all within easy reach. The Grade II-listed Brunswick Centre, home to a large Waitrose and Curzon cinema, is just a 19-minute walk, while the cultural heavyweights of Soho, Covent Garden, Sadler’s Wells and the Barbican are all close enough for spontaneous evenings out. <PARA> Commuters and jet-setters alike will appreciate Farringdon Station, only an eight-minute walk away. Served by the Circle, Elizabeth, Hammersmith & City and Metropolitan lines, with direct trains to Luton and Gatwick in under 40 minutes, this flat is exceptionally well connected. <PARA> Deposit Amount:£2200 <PARA> Rental Amount:£2538 <PARA> Council Tax Band: C <PARA> Local Authority: Camden

A wide and welcoming entrance hall leads to two magnificent reception rooms, both with soaring ceilings, ornate detailing, perfect for stylish entertaining or relaxed everyday living. <PARA> The property comprises three generous double bedrooms, each benefitting from integrated air conditioning, bespoke fitted wardrobes, and large windows that flood the rooms with natural light. title: 4 bedroom house for rent
description: SHORT-LET <PARA> Pricing is subject to availability and season. Higher rates apply for high-season summer months <PARA> Location <PARA> Welcome to this spacious and stylish London home, perfectly positioned between Earls Court, Kensington and South Kensington. Designed with comfort and practicality in mind, the property offers generous living space, contemporary interiors and a stunning roof terrace with impressive views across the surrounding rooftops. Ideal for families, groups or business travellers, it provides a calm and comfortable base in one of London’s most desirable areas. <PARA> Property Description <PARA> The mid-terrace house comfortably accommodates up to nine guests across four well-appointed bedrooms. There is one main bathroom with a bath and three additional bathrooms featuring walk-in showers. The property is arranged over four floors, beginning at ground floor level, offering excellent separation of space for larger groups, including two living/TV rooms. Sleeping arrangements include an en-suite master bedroom with king size bed, an ensuite double bedroom, two further double bedrooms and one single sofa bed. <PARA> The bright open-plan living and kitchen area showcases a clean, modern aesthetic with warm wooden flooring and soft neutral tones enhanced by bold artwork and statement velvet sofas. The space flows effortlessly from the fully equipped contemporary kitchen, complete with integrated appliances and a spacious island, into the dining and lounge area, making it ideal for both relaxed evenings and social gatherings. A large wall-mounted television and comfortable seating create a welcoming place to unwind, while dedicated work desks make the property equally suited to remote working or extended stays. Upstairs, the impressive roof terrace offers fantastic rooftop views and provides the perfect setting for a morning coffee or evening drink. <PARA> DISCLAIMER: Please note that there are multiple internal staircases connecting each level, as well as stairs leading to the roof terrace, which may not be suitable for guests with reduced mobility. <PARA> Neighbourhood <PARA> Earls Court, Kensington and South Kensington are among London’s most prestigious and well-connected neighbourhoods, celebrated for their elegant architecture, cultural landmarks and vibrant dining scene. South Kensington is home to world-renowned museums including the Natural History Museum, the Victoria and Albert Museum and the Science Museum. With Victoria Station just moments away, it's the ideal base for both short getaways and extended stays in London. <PARA> The Space <PARA> Two Comfortable Bedrooms with Hypnos Mattresses <PARA> - Handmade Hypnos mattresses: 1 Super King + 1 King <PARA> - Hotel-quality linens for a restful night's sleep <PARA> - Generous wardrobes and storage ideal for short or long stays <PARA> - Peaceful, uncluttered design <PARA> Fully Equipped Kitchen with ARRO Coffee <PARA> - Oven, stove, microwave, fridge and essential cookware <PARA> - ARRO espresso machine with premium capsules <PARA> - Toaster, kettle and everything needed for easy meals <PARA> - Bright, practical layout perfect for everyday living <PARA> Bright & Welcoming Living Area <PARA> -Large windows that bring in natural light throughout the day <PARA> -Smart TV for relaxed evenings in <PARA> -A calm space to unwind after exploring Belgravia <PARA> - Dinning table <PARA> Modern Bathroom with Anatome Amenities <PARA> - Sleek walk-in shower or bathtub with quality finishes <PARA> - Anatome eco-friendly toiletries provided <PARA> - Soft towels and all essentials fully prepared for your arrival <PARA> Comfort for Work or Leisure <PARA> - Fast Wi-Fi suitable for work, calls and streaming <PARA> - A calm residential backdrop within one of London's most refined postcodes <PARA> - Smart lock for seamless, flexible self check-in <PARA> OUR COMMITMENT TO SUSTAINABILITY <PARA> We are dedicated to reducing our environmental footprint without compromising on comfort. Our cleaning products are eco-friendly, and we work with brands that support global sanitation projects. You'll also find luxurious, sustainable Noble Isle toiletries, which are refillable to minimise waste and reduce plastic use. These eco-friendly choices not only care for the planet but also promote a healthier environment by reducing exposure to harmful toxins. Additionally, for every booking made, we plant a tree through MoreTrees, supporting global reforestation efforts. From the materials we choose to the services we offer, sustainability is at the heart of your stay. <PARA> GUEST ACCESS <PARA> The apartment features a seamless keyless entry system, making self-check-in a breeze. But if you'd prefer a more personal welcome, just let us know , we're happy to stop by and check you in. Our local team is here 24/7 to make sure your stay is seamless and enjoyable. Whether you need assistance with the apartment, local recommendations, or have special requests, we're just a call, text, or email away. <PARA> THE NEIGHBOURHOOD <PARA> Belgravia is one of London's most distinguished neighbourhoods: elegant, peaceful and unmistakably upscale. Staying at The Eccleston places you in a pocket of the city that feels both exclusive and effortlessly livable. Beautiful garden squares, white stucco townhouses and boutique-lined streets give the area its signature charm, while everything you need sits just a short walk away. <PARA> Start your morning with pastries from one of the artisanal bakeries on Elizabeth Street, explore independent shops and florists, or settle into a cosy café for a slow breakfast. Buckingham Palace, Sloane Square, Chelsea, Westminster Abbey, the Royal Parks and the newly redeveloped Eccleston Yards - home to wellness studios, independent eateries and weekend markets - are all just moments away. It's a central location that feels calm, refined and distinctly residential despite being so close to everything London is known for. <PARA> Whether you're here for culture, food, shopping or simply to enjoy a more residential side of the city, Belgravia offers a uniquely balanced mix of sophistication and convenience. <PARA> GETTING AROUND <PARA> The Eccleston is exceptionally well connected, making travel in and out of London effortless. <PARA> Victoria Station is just a short walk away, offering: <PARA> - Victoria, District and Circle Underground lines <PARA> - National Rail services across the South of England <PARA> - Direct links to destinations like Brighton, Surrey, Kent and beyond <PARA> Gatwick Express departs from Victoria every few minutes, giving you a fast, direct route to Gatwick Airport in around 30 minutes. <PARA> Heathrow Airport is easy to reach via: <PARA> - The Elizabeth Line from nearby Paddington (10-15 minutes by taxi) <PARA> - The Piccadilly Line from Knightsbridge or Green Park <PARA> London City Airport is accessible via the District & Jubilee lines with a smooth interchange, ideal for business travellers. <PARA> Bus routes around the corner connect directly to Chelsea, Kensington, Westminster, Piccadilly, Oxford Circus and the West End. <PARA> Many iconic London sights can be reached on foot, including Buckingham Palace, St James's Park, Sloane Square, Westminster Abbey and the Thames.
